# Evolv Technologies Holdings, Inc. (EVLV) - Comprehensive Analysis Report

## 1. Company Overview

Evolv Technologies Holdings, Inc. is a leading security technology company providing AI-based solutions to create safer experiences at stadiums, performing arts centers, theme parks, hospitals, public spaces, offices, schools, workplaces and more. Its flagship product is the Evolv Express, an AI-based concealed weapons detection system designed to detect firearms, improvised explosive devices, and tactical knives. 

Founded in 2013 in Waltham, Massachusetts, Evolv Technology was created with a vision to keep people safer where they gather. The company delivers non-invasive security screening solutions under a unified ecosystem of AI-based advanced security technologies—helping make spaces safer for people to live, work, learn, and play. Evolv is capable of screening up to 4,000 people per hour and regularly screens over three million visitors each day for more than 1,000+ customers worldwide.

## 3. Existing Products/Services

### Core Products:
• **Evolv Express®**: A touchless security screening system designed to detect firearms, improvised explosive devices, and large tactical knives in unstructured people flows, supporting a maximum screening throughput of approximately 4,000 people per hour.

• **Evolv eXpedite™**: An autonomous AI-based weapons detection system to detect concealed weapons in bags using X-ray imaging and AI.

• **Evolv Insights Analytics Application**: Provides self-serve access, insights regarding visitor flow and arrival curves, location specific performance, system detection performance, and alarm statistics.

## 4. Planned Products/Services/Projects

Evolv eXpedite, introduced just a few quarters ago, has already been used to screen more than 1 million bags. The autonomous system uses AI and X-ray imaging to flag potential threats without manual image interpretation and integrates with Evolv Express for a single, cloud-connected checkpoint experience.

The company is continuing to enhance its product portfolio with integrated solutions and software updates to improve detection capabilities and operational efficiency.

## 5. Growth Strategy

Evolv announced a strategic partnership with Plexus to expand production capacity, global reach, and operational resiliency. The company is focused on onboarding them to start manufacturing their products by the first half of 2026, with expectations for larger scale and cost synergies leveraging their global footprint.

The company is currently modeling full-year 2026 revenue of between $160 million to $165 million, with ARR expected to grow by at least 20%, outpacing total revenue growth in 2026. This management team continues to prioritize ARR growth and other long-term value drivers.

## 6. Current and Potential Major Clients

• Gillette Stadium (New England Patriots and New England Revolution), with over 7 million guests screened since the initial 2021 partnership

### Healthcare:

### 2025 Guidance:

## 8. Market Shares

Evolv welcomed over 60 new customers in Q3 and raised its year-end estimate for active subscriptions to between 8,000 and 8,100. The company continues to deliver real-world impact at scale—screening millions of visitors every day across over 1,000 customers.

## 9. Comparison to Competitors

### Major Competitors:
• **Xtract One Technologies**: A technology-driven threat detection and security solution leveraging AI, focusing on the sporting arena and entertainment venue space with high-volume traffic.
• **Athena Security**: Offers a weapons detection system that can identify concealed weapons while allowing everyday items, such as cell phones, to pass without triggering the system.
• **SafePointe (SoundThinking)**: Provides an optimal balance between advanced threat detection, flexibility, cost-efficiency, and a seamless visitor experience with state-of-the-art technology.
• **Traditional competitors**: Teledyne FLIR, Mettler-Toledo International, Liberty Defense Holdings, Smiths Detection, and Rapiscan Systems

### Competitive Advantages:
• One Express system can replace up to 10 traditional metal detectors, with significantly less staffing requirements
• Evolv's subscription pricing model is among the more expensive of the walk-through products on the market, but Express systems support the highest amount of "walk-through" traffic
